intro: Pterochaeta paniculata, commonly known as the panicled pterochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a panicle of small yellow flowers, which are often clustered in dense, showy clusters. Pterochaeta paniculata is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
